snippet: A study indicated a slowing of costs for hospitals and doctors that collaborated to keep a defined group of patients healthier, a model promoted by the federal health care law.
abstract: Study in The Journal of the American Medical Association indicates that the creation of accountable care organizations, promoted by the federal health care law, holds promise for slowing the costs for hospitals and doctors treating the sickest, most expensive patients; more than 150 such groups now serve about 2.4 million Medicare patients.
lead_paragraph: A study indicated a slowing of costs for hospitals and doctors that collaborated to keep a defined group of patients healthier, a model promoted by the federal health care law.

headline.seo: Medical Care Networks Show Savings, Study Finds
headline.main: New Medical Care Networks Show Savings
headline.print_headline: New Medical Care Networks Show Savings
